forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. North northwest wind 10 to 14 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 5 to 14 mph.

weather_report:
As twilight tucks itself into the folds of the Bay Area, Downtown San Francisco sits beneath a cool and mostly clear sky. The air, crisp and fresh, carries whispers of winds from the north-northwest at a gentle 10 to 14 mph, creating a serene ambiance ideal for a nighttime stroll. With temperatures expected to linger around a brisk 46 degrees, an extra layer is advisable, perhaps a warm jacket or cozy sweater, to embrace the evening without haste.

Moving into Monday, the promise of a mostly sunny day unfolds with highs nearing 54 degrees, softening to a pleasant 52 in the afternoon. The sunlight will illuminate the city’s iconic landmarks, reflecting off buildings and enhancing the vibrant energy that defines the streets. While there may be fleeting spells of fog nearby, the city itself will likely remain clear—a delightful contrast to the typically fog-cloaked mornings of winter. Such conditions beckon residents to enjoy a casual day—perhaps a leisurely visit to a local café to savor a warm drink, or an afternoon ramble through the historic alleys, soaking in the ambiance as life unfolds at a gentle pace.
